author: Simon A Chester
title: Toledo TE Michael Roberts met with Steelers before his Pro Day
text:
While some of the Pittsburgh Steelers staff were focused on free agency this Monday, other coaches and scouts were out on the road. As part of a week that will feature a number of significant schools hosting their Pro Day events, Toledo was just one of the colleges opening their doors to the league on Monday.
Not known as a hotbed for NFL level talent, the Rockets have a talent at tight end that appears to have drawn the attention of the Black and Gold. Steelers tight end coach James Daniel reportedly was on hand to watch Michael Roberts go through his paces having met extensively with the young prospect the night before. This news comes from Tony Pauline of Draft Insider. Daniel was just one of many to be keeping a close eye on Roberts as he went through his drills.
Steelers and Lions working out Anthony Kukwa and Michael Roberts right now pic.twitter.com/ct7jUVc2Lj 
— News-Herald preps (@NHPreps) March 20, 2017 
Related: Steelers sign free agent RB/KR Knile Davis 
In a deep tight end class, Roberts may be a step behind the top names in his group but shows a lot of promise for the future, a sign of just how deep the 2017 crop might be. Standing 6-foot-4 and weighing in around 261-pounds, Roberts is a capable blocker and receiver.
Showing surprising agility and quickness for a man his size, Roberts may not possess the top-end speed some teams covet but is more athletic that others might assume.
Toledo TE Michael Roberts is another excellent mid round option. Loaded TE class. pic.twitter.com/ShpqUmu7ux 
— Daniel Jeremiah (@MoveTheSticks) March 20, 2017 
His college opposition was not always of the highest caliber making it hard to judge some of his tape, however, Roberts did not look out of his depth when given an opportunity to take part in the Senior Bowl.
After a senior season to remember, one when he caught 16 touchdowns from 45 receptions for 533-yards, Roberts was sure to grab some attention around the league. He will need to work on his route running and become more consistent with his run blocking, but could be an interesting selection for the Steelers on day three.
